title: Here's a recap of Trump's third week in office
text: On Jan. 27, President Trump signed an executive order that suspended entry to the U.S. for visitors from seven mostly Muslim countries for at least 90 days, froze the entire U.S. refugee program for four months, and indefinitely banned refugees from Syria. Here's a timeline of how that order had fared in the courts so far:
summary:
On Jan. 27, President Trump signed an executive order that suspended entry to the U.S. for visitors from seven mostly Muslim countries for at least 90 days, froze the entire U.S. refugee program for four months, and indefinitely banned refugees from Syria.
